algorithm_technique: BFS to find distances from corners, then map nodes to grid coordinates.
problem_summary_simple: Arrange graph nodes in a 2D grid so adjacent nodes are neighbors.
problem_summary_technical: Construct a 2D grid layout for a graph where adjacency in the grid matches graph edges using BFS.
key_insights: The nodes with the minimum degree (2) are the corners of the grid.
BFS from two different corners can establish the grid dimensions and node positions.
The Manhattan distance in the grid can be derived from the BFS distances.
